task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 264°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full building height, so I'll tilt up to capture the roofline and floors for estimation.
I’m now facing north instead of the target west-facing building, so I should rotate left to heading ~270° while keeping the upward pitch to assess the roofline.
To estimate height I need the building’s top and base in view, so I’ll tilt up to capture the roofline while staying aimed west at the facade.
The view has snapped back to north again, so I need to rotate left to face the west building (heading ~270°) while keeping the upward pitch for height estimation.
To estimate the building height I need to see the roofline clearly, so I will tilt the camera upward while staying aimed at the west-facing facade.
I’m again facing north instead of the target west building, so I should rotate left back to 270° to view the building for height estimation.
We keep returning to pitch 0°, so to judge height I need an upward view of the roofline while staying on the west-facing building.
Since the view keeps snapping to heading 0° after tilting up, I’ll rotate left to 270° while keeping pitch 30° so the west building stays in view.
Rather than tilting up (which seems to reset the heading), I should move closer to the west-facing building to better gauge floor count and height from the facade.
I need to face the target building more directly (west/southwest) before estimating height, so I’ll rotate left toward ~264°.
I’m still not facing west; I should rotate left about 54° to align with ~264° and view the building facade for height estimation.
The heading is still 306°; I need to rotate further left to about 264° to face the target building directly.
Rotation attempts are oscillating, so I’ll use the preset to look left to heading 228° then adjust toward 264° next.
Now that I’m correctly facing west toward the building, I should stop navigating and provide a height estimate based on visible floor count and typical story height.
